H0.text: Who gave his name to the scientific law that states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature. Charles

H1.text: Who gave his name to the scientific law that states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature. Gay-Lussac

H2.text: Who gave his name to the scientific law that states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature. Avogadro

H3.text: Who gave his name to the scientific law that states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature. Boylean

A4.text: Boyle's law is named after Robert Boyle, who published the original law in 1662.
